title: Question:
author: gio3442
content: WikiLeaks was perhaps one of the first organizations that acfepted donations in BTC. Now its founder is in jail pending extradition to the U.S.. with charges under the espionage act. I'd like to know how the crowd of this forum thinks of WikiLeaks founder. Please explain your answer.

comments.author: Kavelj22
comments.body: The founder of WikiLeaks is considered one of the few specialists in his field. He has developmental skills and experience that enabled him to found WikiLeaks and confront international powers. Bitcoin helped the founder of WikiLeaks to fund his project and this was a mutual benefit as he contributed to spreading awareness of the Bitcoin culture in its early days.On the other hand, I do not think that he will be handed over to the United States, especially with the current crisis between America and the West against Russia, which receives Assange on its soil.

comments.author: cabron
comments.body: Julian Assange is from Australia. Extradition doesn't sound like it applies to him. But they wouldn't need him to be sent to the US for now. To some, he is a freedom fighter. To them, he is committing espionage. He can be a held hero when he is given freedom that what it will look like.
